newsitem.title: UK: EMI has no comment on merger talk report.
newsitem.headline: EMI has no comment on merger talk report.

text.p: Leading UK music publisher EMI Group Plc said it had no comment on a newspaper report alleging it had been in merger talks with Seagram Co Ltd, the Canadian drinks and entertainment group.
A spokesman for EMI said it was the company's closed period and could not comment.
EMI shares were up 33 pence at 1205p by 0820 GMT on volume of 210,000 after, dealers said, the Financial Times newspaper reported EMI had broken off merger discussions with Seagram.
Neither company has previously made any mention of being in merger talks. The FT said EMI has long been regarded as a takeover target and Seagram was seen as the likeliest bidder.
Bid speculation for EMI intensified last summer when the group demerged from its former parent Thorn EMI which split up its music and rental businesses.
